fields.description:
The little popups from MCE for colour picker, emoticons and symbols have no common body class. This means you can't style them and they incorrectly pick up background images from themes.

Solution is to add a class to the MCE popups so they can be styled. They are different enough from standard popups that a separate class is advisable; this way they can be co-styled or separately styled.
fields.summary: MCE popups have no class

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-18509].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - April 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
The Confluence server development team has now completed both item 1 (Support for emoji in MySQL) and item 2 (providing meaningful error messages). We strongly encourage customers to follow the [steps outlined in our documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/how-to-fix-the-collation-and-character-set-of-a-mysql-database-744326173.html] to migrate from UTF8 to UTF8MB4, completely resolving this issue.

If you are unable to migrate to UTF8MB4 we have added a number of meaningful error messages to Confluence to stop users attempting to add unsupported 4-byte characters. We have added these errors to:
 * page publish/save events for pages and blogs 
 * page titles
 * comment/inline comment saves.

Please note that we have not added this error message to content fields that are less used/less likely to contain 4byte characters including:
 * comments accessed via email,
 * the editor in Questions for Confluence,
 * comments on attachments,
 * gadget comments,
 * attachment titles
 * content added via Confluence Mobile. 

From the Confluence development team, we want to say thank you for everyone who provided feedback as part of both of the fixes mentioned above. We hope you now enjoy an emoji-filled Confluence. 

Regards,

The Confluence Server Team
{panel}
The following error:
{noformat}
org.springframework.jdbc.UncategorizedSQLException: Hibernate operation: could not update: com.atlassian.confluence.core.BodyContent#38141954; uncategorized SQLException for SQL []; SQL state [HY000]; error code [1366]; Incorrect string value: '\xF4\x80\x82\x84 z...' for column 'BODY' at row 1; nested exception is java.sql.SQLException: Incorrect string value: '\xF4\x80\x82\x84 z...' for column 'BODY' at row 1
Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: Incorrect string value: '\xF4\x80\x82\x84 z...' for column 'BODY' at row 1
at com.mysql.jdbc.SQLError.createSQLException(SQLError.java:1055)
at com.mysql.jdbc.SQLError.createSQLException(SQLError.java:956)
at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.checkErrorPacket(MysqlIO.java:3536)
{noformat}
is thrown by confluence when your try to save a page with bullet points copied from an external source (Pdf,etc).

It appears to be directly related to this MySQL limitation: [http://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=28853]

We should handle this gracefully since it is a known limitation for MySQL.

*Note:* This errors can also happen in the following situations:
 # Restoring an XML backup into a MySQL database
 # Attempting to log into Confluence
 For the login failure, the error message will look like this:
{code:java}
url:/dologin.action] [engine.jdbc.spi.SqlExceptionHelper] logExceptions Incorrect string value: '\xF0\x9F\x98\x8E p...' for column 'description' at row 1
{code}

h6. Workaround for XML imports:

Use XML cleaner from [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/'Incorrect+string+value'+error+thrown+when+restoring+XML+backup+in+Confluence].

Also documented here
 * [https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/saving-page-throws-unable-to-communicate-with-server-message-921470725.html]

h6. Workaround for login issues

If you are seeing the *Incorrect string value* errors for the */dologin.action* requests, proceed as follows:
 # Find the offending groups on the AD side and remove the 4-byte characters from the description based on the memberships of the user that cannot log in, or
 # Change the Description attribute to the CN instead on the directory settings in Confluence
fields.summary: MySQL databases incapable of handling 4byte UTF-8 Characters. Confluence should handle this gracefully

fields.description:
When editing a page and saving, if you get a 500page when saving, users feel like they have lost their entered data. Actually the 500page has the entered data, e.g. {noformat} ... Post wysiwygcontent

  • System Administrator: Has complete control and access to all administrative functions.
  • Confluence Administrator: Can administer the application but is disallowed from operations that may compromise system security.

    • ... {noformat} Buried half way down the 500page. We should make this more prominent so users don't think they have lost all their data due to the error.
fields.summary: Make the entered content of a page in 500 jsp page more prominent to customers

fields.description:
I'm trying, and failing, to include images that appear as attachment to blog posts.


I've ported an old blogger blog into my personal confluence installation.  Some blog posts have images (Confluence will allow me to more easily add even more) attached.

I'm creating Confluence page's with central themes, eg. a trip to Brasil, that I have several tagged blog posts about.
On this page I want to include *all* images from these blog posts according to my tags.

I see this exact functionality does not exist according to the documentation
However, I am supposed to be able to add images that appear on a page.

Blog posts apparently are not "pages", so I can't do this.  Or, I just don't know how to name a specific blog post so that it can work as I want.  I've tried:
No pictures: a blog posts' title, YYYY/MM/DD/Title
Pictures: a page name


I (probably?) replicated the problem in the sandbox, http://sandbox.onconfluence.com/display/ds/gallery+macro+include+blog+attachment+images+bug+test
fields.summary: Gallery macro fails to include images from blog posts
Allow the use of pseudo-slashes in macro markup

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-18500].
  {panel}

First of all thank you all for a great program.
	
I am regularly exporting images. Up to now I have used QGIS as my main program. Looking into uDig I can see that uDig is "better" suited for my needs.

But, it is important for me to have images with higher resolution (around 300ppt).

Is it possible to add an option in the exporting wizard where you may choose which resolution you want in the exported image.
fields.summary: Would be very nice to be able to change image resolution before exporting an image.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce while editing a page:
# invoke a draft autosave (either wait for autosave interval or press *Preview*) while editing a page
\\ Draft is now in the database, user is viewing the *editpage.action* based page (http://.../confluence/pages/editpage.action?pageId=xxx)
# wait for SSO timeout
-- click *Save* which redirects user to reauthenticate
\\user is presented with *doeditpage.action* based page (http://.../confluence/pages/doeditpage.action?pageId=xxx) instead {color:blue}(which should be *editpage.action*){color}
-- {color:blue}this can be simulated by opening another tab and entering the *doeditpage.action* equivalent{color}
# user is presented with the *original* page with *no title* as the additional form data was not transmitted
# user has to re-enter data, if they save they loose the draft

\\
Workaround is to open another tab to login after timeout

fields.description:
If I set page viewing restrictions on a wki page (to one group of which I am a member), other users, including confluence adminsistrators, cannot see the page when navigating within the application. If they type in the URL of the restricted page or click on a link to the restricted page, then can view (but not edit) the page. As the page in question contains sensitive information, including production passwords etc, it is a breach of security to allow users outside the group to view the page.

Is there any way I can restrict viewing of this page so that the above scenarios do not result in all confluence administators being able to view the page if they know the URL?

Regards

Nicholas
fields.summary: Confluence adminsistrators can still view a restricted page if the type in the URL or click on a link in an email

fields.description:
When a db exception is thrown while full index rebuild runs, the indexing completes, but no further incremental indexing jobs are executed.

It seems that the exception is not handled well, which results in the problems with future indexing jobs.

The issue is discussed at http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=40706&tstart=0&messageID=257331096

Similar issue were also observed when our server ran our of local disk space on the mount where the index is stored.
fields.summary: Site indexing stops when a db exception occurs

fields.description:
When a username containing a space is selected from the list of auto-completion results in the page restriction dialog, a message like the following is displayed:

{code}
Unknown user or group: user+name
{code}

Entering the full username (including spaces) and hitting the "Restrict" button works as expected, this only happens when clicking the user in the auto-completion results.

Steps to reproduce:

# Create a Crowd user whose username contains a space (such as "user name").
# Log in to Confluence as that user and create a personal space.
# Log out and log in as a different user
# Edit a page
# Start searching for the user by typing the word "name"
# Click the full name for "user name" when it appears
# An error message will appear

I don't know if this problem is reproducible with LDAP users.
fields.summary: Usernames with spaces do not work with page restriction auto-complete

fields.description:
If you set up Confluence to use local users, then set up Crowd authentication, local users will no longer show up in the "User Browser", but will show up in the list of auto-completion results for the page restriction browser.

h2. Screenshot 1: User Browser displaying all users for Crowded Confluence instance

!userBrowser.png|width=100%!

h2. Screenshot 2: Page Restriction auto-complete suggestions for "user"
!pageRestrictionAutoComplete.png|width=100%!

Steps to reproduce:

# Set up Confluence without external authentication
# Add a local user (ex: user1) with the word "User" in their full name.
# log in as the user
# Shut down Confluence
# Set up Crowd authentication
# Make sure at least one Crowd user has the word "User" in their full name
# Log in as a Crowd user
# Edit a page and edit the page restrictions
# Search for "user"

----

Both Crowd and local users will be returned, even though the local users are not visible or manageable.  This occurs whether or not "External User Management" is enabled.
fields.summary: Page Restriction user auto completion displays unusable accounts...

fields.description:
Hi.
Recently both our application server nodes didn't respond to user requests due to application threadpool exhaustion. A quick analysis points at an issue similar to CONF-16184. The user there claimed that turning off the 'did you mean' feature immediately helped. Is it possible to disable this feature in our version (2.6.2)?
fields.summary: Lock contentions in didyoumean code

fields.description:
To reproduce:

# Start Confluence 3.0
# Find a bundled plugin that is disabled by default (i.e. Mail Page Plugin)
# Upgrade it to the latest version (1.8)
# Enable the plugin
# Upgrade Confluence to 3.1
# The plugin is disabled.

You can fix the problem, since as soon as you restart Confluence the plugin is disabled again.
fields.summary: Enabled plugins that are disabled by default don't stay enabled after Confluence upgrades

fields.description: See attachment. Setting up Demo Space gives error: "Set up step error"
fields.summary: Setting Up Demonstration Space in Conf 3.1.1 results in an error

fields.description:
The dates in the _New Spaces Tab_ are rendered according to the _locale_ of the application server, ignoring the user's language.

Attached is a screenshot where the locale is set to en_US.UTF-8 and the user's language to german.
After changing the server's locale to de_DE.UTF-8 the date will be german, but also for users with English as selected language.
fields.summary: "New Spaces Tab" on Dashoard ignores user's language when rendering the date

fields.description:
For Confluence installations where is no context path (so not http://example.com:8080/confluence/ but just http://example.com:8080/) the context path in AJS.params.contextPath is invalid and so if we try to call Macro Browser (in macro-browser.js):

url: AJS.params.contextPath + "/plugins/macrobrowser/browse-macros.action"

the resulting path is:

http://example.com:8080/pages/undefined/plugins/macrobrowser/browse-macros.action

instead of correct one http://example.com:8080/plugins/macrobrowser/browse-macros.action
fields.summary: Incorrect context path calculation for AJS.params

fields.description:
In Windows Installer edition, atlassian-confluence.log and Tomcat logs are nowhere to be found. Not even in _%userprofile%\Application Data\Atlassian Evaluation_. Although there is a "View Log" option provided by the application, the screen buffer is too limited.

This would also make it harder to troubleshoot.
fields.summary: Logs missing from installer edition

fields.description: ReverseDatabinder combines a whole bunch of different things -- XML parsing, backup parsing, Hibernate voodoo, upgrade logic -- in a single class and a couple of badly factored helper classes. This is very resistant to modification and improvement. Replacing it with code that separates these concerns should lead to more stable and flexible restore code over time.
fields.summary: Replace ReverseDatabinder with better factored import code

fields.description:
Expected behaviour of this improvement would be:

While in Wiki Markup editing view, if user enters a "[" character, an autocomplete list appears that offers pages to link to. 

Value: for linking to pages with long names, or if the exact name is not known, allows the user to stay in conext instead of going to search for the page name to link to or using the pointer to bring up the link helper.
fields.summary: Add Autocompletion for Links in Wiki Markup view

fields.description:
Currently only the prototype REST API has transactions due to the servlet filter mapping /rest/prototype/* - most REST APIs will also want transactions hence this should be /rest/*

In future transactions will be added to the REST plugin, but until this is done this is the easiest solution.
fields.summary: Rest Plugins have no Transactions

fields.summary: Drag and drop is not internationalized

fields.description:
The {section} macro shouldn't be used without the use of {column} macros within it as it causes problems when a table is used within it. We need to make this clear in our documentation.

In 3.1.2, we will actually break all usages of the {section} macro without any {column} macros but include tables.

Needs to be changed in:

* Documentation - http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Section+Macro
* Macro browser metadata - Defines a section on a page, which can contain one or more Column macros.
* Exception message when we break usages of it
* Wiki Markup Notation guide - If you want to use columns instead of tables, you can define them first by marking a {section}, and then placing any number of {column}s inside.
fields.summary: Documentation for {section} macro should specify {column} macro requirement

fields.description:
h5. Bug Background
The page permission allows users to restrict other users/group from either viewing or editing the page. This would also work while using LDAP server. Problem occurs when LDAP server is down for some reason. The user is not allowed to even add the local confluence group such as confluence-users or confluence-administrators. There's no problem with restricting local users though.

h5. Steps to reproduce
# Hook up Confluence with LDAP
# Make sure LDAP users can login and work with Confluence
# Shutdown LDAP server and restart Confluence instance
# Go to a page, edit it and try to add a local group to the page restriction:
#* Scenario 1:
#** User keys-in the group name(for example, confluence-users) in the text-field and click the 'Restrict' button
#** Screenshot to depict this: [^Scenario1.png]
#* Scenario 2:
#** User clicks the 'Group' button and select a group from the list using the Group Search
#** Screenshot to depict this: [Before selection|^Scenario2.png] and [Result | ^Scenario2.png]
#* Upon checking the atlassian-confluence.log, the following stacktrace were found which could be the cause for the whole issue:
{quote}
2010-01-27 14:54:09,958 ERROR [http-8080-4] [bucket.user.DefaultUserAccessor] hasMembership javax.naming.CommunicationException: localhost:389 [Root exception is java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused]
 -- url: /pages/getpagepermissions.action | userName: admin | referer: http://localhost:8080/pages/editpage.action?pageId=5767172
2010-01-27 14:54:09,962 ERROR [http-8080-4] [bucket.user.DefaultUserAccessor] hasMembership javax.naming.CommunicationException: localhost:389 [Root exception is java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused]
 -- url: /pages/getpagepermissions.action | userName: admin | referer: http://localhost:8080/pages/editpage.action?pageId=5767172
2010-01-27 14:54:09,965 ERROR [http-8080-4] [bucket.user.DefaultUserAccessor] hasMembership javax.naming.CommunicationException: localhost:389 [Root exception is java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused]
 -- url: /pages/getpagepermissions.action | userName: admin | referer: http://localhost:8080/pages/editpage.action?pageId=5767172
{quote}

h5. Additional Information
# The issue above also affects other permissions in Confluence
# For example, in space permission and global permission, both confluence-administrators and confluence-users are shown as not found. 
# Screenshot for [space permission|^SpacePermission.png]
# Screenshot for [global permission|^GlobalPermission.png]

h5. Findings
# If in atlassian-user.xml, the hibernate datasource is declared above the ldap datasource, this problem won't occur.
fields.summary: When LDAP server is down, Confluence permission breaks

fields.description:
Confluence 3.2-m2 contains an implementation of CONF-7745 such that existing feeds requesting just blogs and comments no longer report comments on pages.

While this may seem intuitive to many, some users have expressed confusion at the sudden change, and frustration at being unable to now request just blog posts and comments on everything.

Suggestions:
* Change the UI to allow the old behaviour.
* Change the implementation to require different URL syntax to achieve CONF-7745 so that users have to create a new feed to get the new behaviour.
* All of the above.
fields.summary: Existing feeds suddenly stopped including comments on pages
Auto-complete feature in the page restriction should include group names
Searches should catch BooleanQuery$TooManyClauses exceptions

fields.description:
NeoOffice (3.1.2 Patch 2 and Patch 0, Intel version) does not work with 'Edit in Office' nor 'Edit in Word'.

While the attached document or Confluence page can open correctly, saving back the content will generate 'General Input/Output Error'. See [^screenshot.png].

For .xls document, NeoOffice 3.1.2 will not be able to save back to Confluence (you can only choose save as).

The PowerPC version of NeoOffice 3.0.1 also fail. It opens the page up just fine but you cannot save back to Confluence.

Older version of NeoOffice (3.0.1 and 3.0.0 Intel versions) works fine in Confluence (tested with 3.1 and 3.4.3).
fields.summary: Office Connector - NeoOffice - Edit in word does not save back to Confluence
Create a documentation on how to uninstall plugins in Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-18362].
  {panel}

h1. Situation Overview
Marketing videos say Confluence could replace your "old fileshare". I feel it has significant limitations, though. Users often create hierarchies to structure multiple files. In fileshares, you can create folders and subfolders to do that. In Confluence, users cannot create file hierarchies. Every folder created in WebDAV automatically creates a page and places it into the navigation hierarchy. Often, it's not a page users want to help them store and organize multiple files.
 
As Confluence prohibits the creation of pages with the same name by design, navigation entries cannot have the same name. Every organization that documents a repetitive process cannot create pages with the name of the process step. Imagine a company doing projects. In every project, one or multiple offers are exchanged. So every project has an "Offer" folder. Maybe the project has multiple phases and concepts and documents are written. Those documents are then saved in the "Phase 1 - Conception" folder. Now in Confluence it's not possible to do it this way. The next project's "Phase 1 - Conception" folder would collide with the previous project's folder.

+Example - does not work:+
- Project 1
-- Offers
-- Phase 1
--- Conception
--- Implementation
-- Phase 2
-- [...]

- Project 2
-- {color:red}Offers (collision){color}
-- {color:red}Phase 1 (collision){color}
--- {color:red}Conception (collision){color}
--- [...]

h1. Additional Thoughts
On the other hand, it's not needed to have a page for every folder. What would you write on the "Offer" page anyway. Nevertheless you would like to store the offers that went out to the client in a folder. Now imagine if your project's documentation is extensive and has many sub-phases. You just want to store the documents in folders but you don't necessarily need a page in the sub-sub-sub-folder of phase 1. It's enough to describe the project on the main project phase and then just store all available documents and documentation below that one project page.

Now, you LOVE Confluence's indexing feature and would like to be able to search through all your documents attached to your project pages. But you can't import your folder structure as it generates collisions.

h1. Feature Request
For these cases and users (including myself and our whole company), I suggest adding a special folder similar to the "@export" or "@versions" folders there are now. I'll this special folder "@attachments" for now.

In this "@attachments" folder, the normal Confluence universe is suspended. Creating a subfolder in "@attachments" doesn't create a page. Also, the "unique name of pages" limitation could be suspended. Files and folders would behave like in normale fileshares in those "@attachments" folders. File versioning would still work, though, as would the full-text search and all the other special benefits and gadgets of Confluence such as rendering Word documents as HTML pages and so on.

Going to the attachments tab on a Confluence page containing "@attachments" would display the contents and enable browsing through the subfolders similar to a file browser. So people could access the files and folders through the browser via the attachments tab as well as via WebDAV.

This would really get rid of a) fileshares and b) the unique page limitation. In turn it would add the complete benefits of Confluence's powerful file handling features.

+Example - could work:+
- Project 1 (add your Macros and beloved Confluence features)
-- @attachments (from here, Confluence's page creation is suspended for folders)
--- Offers
--- Phase 1
---- Offers (it's even possible to have 2 folders with the same name within @attachments)
---- Conception
---- Implementation
--- Phase 2
--- [...]

- Project 2 (add your Macros and beloved Confluence features)
-- @attachments
--- {color:blue}Offers (no conflict, as the @attachments folder mimics fileshare functionality, there can be as many Offer folders as you like, no pages and no navigation will be created in the Confluence navigation menu for folders created inside @attachments){color}
--- {color:blue}Phase 1{color}
---- {color:blue}Offers{color}
---- {color:blue}Conception{color}
---- {color:blue}Implementation{color}
--- {color:blue}Phase 2{color}
---- [...]


I assume this would also be the solution for a lot of people voting for sub-spaces as many create spaces due to this unique page name limitation and are looking for a way to organize their overflowing amount of spaces as a consequence.
fields.summary: Enable special attachment folder that can contain files and subfolders - suspending Confluence's page creation when subfolder is created

fields.description:
The strange part about this bug is that it only appears to affect the Recently Updated macro in one of our Confluence Spaces ONLY, all the others render fine. I have done most of the leg-work for you; I have determined what is wrong with the HTML/CSS that is generated, but I don't know what processing problem happened in the JSP layer behind the scenes in order to cause the HTML to become mal-formed. As you can see below, the "recently-updated/recently-updated-concise" DIV tag is closed prematurely when the Recently Updated items fail to render properly in the browser:

Recently Updated

The "recently-updated/recently-updated-concise" div should encapsulate all of the updated items (at least that's how the pages that render properly are formed when I compare them), but since it is closed prematurely none of the Recently Updated Items inherit the proper display properties from the "recently-updated/recently-updated-concise" CSS classes, and you get the garbage list seen in the *_wanked* screenshots Also, should the hidden fieldset tag be empty? It wasn't in any of the other working Recently Updated item lists that I compared the problem page with. (perhaps it's related?) I am attaching 4 screenshots taken in FireFox/FireBug while inspecting the broken elements in question. The atlassian-confluence.log file shows no errors when the problem occurs. Also note that the data was migrated from Confluence v2.1 (we're in the process of upgrading to v3.1 from v2.1)
fields.summary: Recently Updated Macro Writes out Prematurely Closed DIV's resulting in CSS/Rendering Errors

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-18358].
  {panel}

The Linux installation documentation could use some attention. 

From a customer request:
What we need is a better step-by-step "production" Confluence-Standalone installation procedures for Linux. Existing procedures are documented in several places:

Database Setup For MySQL - Confluence Docs 3.1 - Atlassian Documentation - Confluence.URL
Start Confluence automatically on Linux & Unix - Confluence Docs 3.1 - Atlassian Documentation - Confluence.URL
Installing Confluence Standalone on Unix or Linux - Confluence Docs 3.1 - Atlassian Documentation - Confluence.URL
Running Confluence behind Apache - Confluence Docs 3.1 - Atlassian Documentation - Confluence.URL

We found that the basic instructions were great at helping us get to a rudimentary install http://server:8080/. What is unclear is how best to secure the installation.

For example, we did:

chown -R confluence.confluence /usr/local/confluence
chown -R confluence.confluence /usr/local/confluence-data

It was unclear how to check the CHMOD settings in these folders to be sure they conform to known best-practices for securing a Confluence installation. Some discussion of best-practices would be reassuring.

In the area of starting Confluence automatically, it should be stressed that creating the script /etc/init.d/confluence, the following issues can occur:

This sequence of commands starts Confluence as user "confluence". When logged as root, do not use /usr/local/confluence/bin/startup.sh as this starts a second instance of Confluence as user "root". There are no obvious error messages when this is done, other than the "startup.sh" script will change the ownership of certain files so that Confluence will not subsequently start as user "confluence" until a series of "CHOWN -R" commands are performed on /usr/local/confluence and /usr/local/confluence-data.

chkconfig --add confluence
chkconfig confluence on
/etc/init.d/confluence start

Proxying using Tomcat does not work on RHEL 5.4. Apache was running under user/group "apache.apache" while confluence was running under user "confluence.confluence". It's not clear if this is the source of this problem or the ways things should be for good security practice. We're currently stuck with "http://server:8080/ after weeks of fiddling. There should be discussion about best practices for changing the ports.
fields.summary: Improve Linux installation documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-18346].
  {panel}

When editing a Wiki page, the Save and Cancel buttons are very close.  I accidentally clicked Cancel recently after a major edit.

Two suggestions: Add more space between them.  Not all users have the same level of motor skills with a mouse.  On our keyboard/mouse splitters shared across multiple PCs, the mouse accuracy is much lower.

Or: Add a confirmation dialog when Cancel is clicked.  Optionally, only show it if the page content has changed.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Allow undo or prompt when hitting cancel on edit page or add comment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-18345].
  {panel}

JIRA's SQL logging is awesome. It's expensive, but very detailed and useful. It's written as an OfBiz interceptor that logs not only the SQL query, but the associated stack trace that called it. This allows support to trace back a questionable SQL query to its associated method call.

JIRA's is called LoggingSQLInterceptor which implement org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.interceptors.SQLInterceptor, so Confluence's would need a hibernate equivalent. Looks like there's one available:

https://www.hibernate.org/hib_docs/v3/api/org/hibernate/Interceptor.html

Ideally, this could even be added to the Logging and Profiling SQL setting.
fields.summary: Improve Confluence SQL Logging
